title: Bug 49890 - Nio Selector issue on Linux platform
description:
Bug 49890 - Nio Selector issue on Linux platform

Created attachment 25997: NioEndpoint.java and simple web application

Sometimes the server's CPU reaches 100% and stays at 100% until the server is restarted. This issue has been reproduced with Java versions 1.6.007, 1.6.018, 1.6.021. It is a duplicate of issue Bug 46373.

It appears that the Jetty team has fixed a similar problem: http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JETTY937?focusedCommentId=168060&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:commenttabpanel.

I have added some logging to NioEndpoint.java.

Attachments:
- NioEndpoint.7z
- Patched NioEndpoint.java (with logging)
- web.7z
- Simple web application.
OB: With this logging, we can observe that selector.select(timeout) sometimes returns zero keys on the Linux platform.
SR: This issue has not been reproduced on the Windows platform.
